title: goreleaser release fails as of v2.4.0
body:
### What happened?

I'm not sure if I missed something, or if there's an actual issue as of `2.4.0`. The error I'm seeing is `error=failed to build for windows_arm64_v8.0: fork/exec C:\Program Files\Go\bin\go.exe: The parameter is incorrect.:` It is reproducible using this [georeleaser](https://github.com/JanDeDobbeleer/oh-my-posh/blob/main/src/.goreleaser.yml) file and project.


### How can we reproduce this?

Clone oh-my-posh, and run `goreleaser release --clean --skip publish --verbose` in the `src` folder. This will fail in the post hook, but that's past the issue already when using `2.3.2`.

### goreleaser version

```bash
GitVersion:    v2.4.0
GitCommit:     unknown
GitTreeState:  unknown
BuildDate:     unknown
BuiltBy:       unknown
GoVersion:     go1.23.2
Compiler:      gc
ModuleSum:     h1:2jFhcbo7+K2N7kgMH46t1qHreHQlFLL/vh3V+btZQTE=
Platform:      windows/arm64
```


### GoReleaser Check

- [X] goreleaser check shows no errors
